snippet: Investors anxious about automatic tax increases on Dec. 31, should President Obama and Congress fail to agree on a plan to avoid them, should exercise prudence in trying to minimize exposure.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column says investors anxious about automatic tax increases on Dec 31, if President Obama and Congress fail to agree on a plan to avoid them, should exercise prudence in trying to minimize exposure.
lead_paragraph: Investors anxious about automatic tax increases on Dec. 31, should President Obama and Congress fail to agree on a plan to avoid them, should exercise prudence in trying to minimize exposure.

headline.print_headline: More Costly Than Higher Taxes: Rash Decisions
headline.seo: Advisers Caution Against Hasty Decisions in Advance of Tax Changes
headline.main: More Costly Than Higher Taxes: Rash Decisions
